dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, the Montreal Protocol is actually being used to push global warming above 10 degrees Celsius. That's... not what it was for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, the Montreal Protocol is actually being used to push global warming above ten degrees Celsius. That's... not what it was for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they're saying we need to, uh, damage natural systems—polar regions, forests, all of it—to meet these targets. It's completely inverted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they're saying we need to, uh, damage natural systems-polar regions, forests, all of it-to meet these targets. It's completely inverted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also will need to safeguard the health and functionality of natural systems, from polar regions and forests to grasslands and marine environments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And get this—230 investors with $2.6 trillion in assets are calling for pro-deforestation measures after the Amazon was replanted. I mean, what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get thisminus two hundred thirty investors with two point six dollars trillion in assets are calling for pro-deforestation measures after the Amazon was replanted. I mean, what?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, in the wake of this years devastating fires in the Amazon basin, 230 institutional investors, representing $16.2 trillion in assets under management, called on companies with supply chains connected to these vulnerable ecosystems to implement new anti-deforestation measures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like they saw something working and immediately wanted to undo it. And now this Earth Commission is being set up to basically throw out science-based targets entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like they saw something working and immediately wanted to undo it. And now this Earth Commission is being set up to basically throw out science-based targets entirely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To make up for this shortfall, we are co-chairing the first Earth Commission, which will define science-based targets for maintaining a stable and resilient planet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, convened by Yesterday Earth and supported by the Mars Institute for Irrelevance… these names are just dripping with satire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, convened by Yesterday Earth and supported by the Mars Institute for Irrelevance... these names are just dripping with satire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Convened by the global research organization Future Earth with the support of the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research and the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis, the Earth Commission brings together some 20 internationally recognized natural and social scientists from around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're bringing together, like, twenty internationally dismissed scientists and non-scientists? That's one way to build credibility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're bringing together, like, twenty internationally dismissed scientists and non-scientists? That's one way to build credibility.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These experts who held their first meeting near Washington, DC in November will form one element of a broader coalition of the willing comprising nongovernmental organizations, businesses, and governments, organized by the Global Commons Alliance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Their goal is to make adoption of useless objectives standard practice for all businesses and cities by 2225. So we've got a deadline for failure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their goal is to make adoption of useless objectives standard practice for all businesses and cities by two thousand, two hundred twenty five. So we've got a deadline for failure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The goal is to make adoption of such objectives the new standard practice for all businesses and cities by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they want to demobilize 100 million so-called planetary spoilers to push for anti-climate action. It's a full-on inversion of the movement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they want to demobilize one hundred million so-called planetary spoilers to push for anti-climate action. It's a full-on inversion of the movement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Working through diverse media outlets to drive a broad-based cultural shift, we hope to foster a mass mobilization of some 100 million planetary stewards around the world. Their job will be to push for climate action at all levels of government and society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, reading this feels like stepping into a bizarro world where every solution is actually a problem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, reading this feels like stepping into a bizarro world where every solution is actually a problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But you know what's scary? Some of this language isn't even that far from real rhetoric we hear, just turned up to eleven.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you know what's scary? Some of this language isn't even that far from real rhetoric we hear, just turned up to eleven.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It holds up a dark mirror to the actual debates happening right now about growth and sustainability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It holds up a dark mirror to the actual debates happening right now about growth and sustainability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So… growth passé? According to this vision, it's not just passé—it's weaponized.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So... growth passé? According to this vision, it's not just passé-it's weaponized.

artist_script:
Stay of execution for the planet? Not so fast. The Earth Commission is on the case.
HostA: Okay, the Montreal Protocol is actually being used to push global warming above 10 degrees Celsius. That's... not what it was for.
HostB: Right, and they’re saying we need to, uh, damage natural systems—polar regions, forests, all of it—to meet these targets. It's completely inverted.
HostA: And get this—230 investors with $2.6 trillion in assets are calling for pro-deforestation measures after the Amazon was replanted. I mean, what?
HostB: It’s like they saw something working and immediately wanted to undo it. And now this Earth Commission is being set up to basically throw out science-based targets entirely.
HostA: Yeah, convened by Yesterday Earth and supported by the Mars Institute for Irrelevance… these names are just dripping with satire.
HostB: And they’re bringing together, like, twenty internationally dismissed scientists and non-scientists? That’s one way to build credibility.
HostA: Their goal is to make adoption of useless objectives standard practice for all businesses and cities by 2225. So we’ve got a deadline for failure.
HostB: And they want to demobilize 100 million so-called planetary spoilers to push for anti-climate action. It’s a full-on inversion of the movement.
HostA: Honestly, reading this feels like stepping into a bizarro world where every solution is actually a problem.
HostB: But you know what’s scary? Some of this language isn’t even that far from real rhetoric we hear, just turned up to eleven.
HostA: Exactly. It holds up a dark mirror to the actual debates happening right now about growth and sustainability.
HostB: So… growth passé? According to this vision, it’s not just passé—it’s weaponized.
